title: Estimate of definite integral with Riemann sum

content.question: Let f be the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup> <mn>9</mn> <mi>x</mi> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp caaI5aWaaWbaaSqabeaacaWG4baaaaaa@3C99@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>. If four subintervals of equal length are used, what is the value of the right Riemann sum approximation for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>âˆ«</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>2</mn> </msubsup> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeGaamOzaaWcpaqaa8qacaaIWaaapaqaa8qacaaI YaaaniabgUIiYdGcdaqadaWdaeaapeGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaai aadsgacaWG4baaaa@3F92@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>?

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Explain how an approximated value relates to the actual value.
